metadata.Title: CVE-2021-3472 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in xorg-x11-server in versions before 1.20.11. An integer underflow can occur in xserver which can lead to a local privilege escalation. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to data confidentiality and integrity as well as system availability.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2021-3472` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

xdmx - 2:1.20.11-1ubuntu1
xdmx-tools - 2:1.20.11-1ubuntu1
xnest - 2:1.20.11-1ubuntu1
xorg-server-source - 2:1.20.11-1ubuntu1
xserver-common - 2:1.20.11-1ubuntu1
xserver-xephyr - 2:1.20.11-1ubuntu1
xserver-xorg-core - 2:1.20.11-1ubuntu1
xserver-xorg-legacy - 2:1.20.11-1ubuntu1
xvfb - 2:1.20.11-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

xwayland - 2:21.1.1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> xorg server is actually the xorg-server package the xorg package only contains docs amurray> Also known as ZDI-CAN-12549

criterions.comment: xorg-server package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:1.20.11-1ubuntu1').
xwayland package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:21.1.1-0ubuntu1').
